headline: Colorado’s COVID cases tick up for first time since January, hospitalizations appear to be falling more slowly
author: Meg Wingerter
sentences:
Most Popular
Kiszla: Nuggets center Nikola Jokic, on verge of winning second straight MVP award, has lost seven straight NBA playoff games
Warriors’ Klay Thompson on Jamal Murray: “You don’t want to put your whole future at risk” to rush return

The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment reported 2,488 new cases in the week ending Sunday, up from 1,598 the previous week — the first week-over-week increase in new infections since the omicron surge peaked in January.
Colorado’s COVID-19 cases and the percentage of tests coming back positive both ticked up over the last week, though they remained near all-time lows.
